org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as

Class ExpressionNodeBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.common.SourceLocation
      • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.NodeBase
        • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.FixedChildrenNode
          • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.ExpressionNodeBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISourceLocation, IASNode, IExpressionNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseLiteralContainerNode, BaseStatementExpressionNode, ClassReferenceNode, EmbedNode, FoldedExpressionNode, FunctionCallNode, FunctionObjectNode, IdentifierNode, LiteralNode, NilNode, ObjectLiteralValuePairNode, OperatorNodeBase, RuntimeNameExpressionNode, TypedExpressionNode, VariableExpressionNode

    public abstract class ExpressionNodeBase
extends FixedChildrenNode
implements IExpressionNode
    ActionScript parse tree node representing an expression

      • normalize

        public void normalize(boolean fillInOffsets)
        Normalize the tree. Move custom children into the real child list and fill in missing offsets so that offset lookup will work. Used during parsing.
        Overrides:
        normalize in class NodeBase

        Description copied from class: NodeBase

        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • resolve

        public IDefinition resolve(ICompilerProject project)
        Description copied from interface: IExpressionNode
        If this expression is statically known to refer to a definition return a reference to that definition. In many cases this will return the same definition as resolveType, but when an identifier resolves to an member variable or member function of a class, this method will return the IDefinition for the member variable or member function not the definition for the type of the member variable or the member function.
        Specified by:
        resolve in interface IExpressionNode
        Parameters:
        project - The ICompilerProject to use to do lookups.
        Returns:
        The IDefinition this expression refers to.

      • resolveType

        public ITypeDefinition resolveType(ICompilerProject project)
        Description copied from interface: IExpressionNode
        The type of the result of this expression. This method returns the IDefinition representing the type that is the result of this expression. This can differ from the IDefinition you get from resolve(), such as when called on a FunctionCallNode: resolve() will return the IDefinition for the Function, whereas resolveType() will return the return type of the Function.
        Specified by:
        resolveType in interface IExpressionNode
        Parameters:
        project - The ICompilerProject to use to do lookups.
        Returns:
        The ITypeDefinition of the type this expression results in.

      • isDynamicExpression

        public boolean isDynamicExpression(ICompilerProject project)
        Description copied from interface: IExpressionNode
        Does this expression evaluate to a dynamic value
        Specified by:
        isDynamicExpression in interface IExpressionNode
        Parameters:
        project - The ICompilerProject to use to do lookups.
        Returns:
        true if we evaluate to something dynamic

      • copyForInitializer

        public ExpressionNodeBase copyForInitializer(IScopedNode scopedNode)
        Description copied from interface: IExpressionNode
        Return a copy of this IExpressionNode and all it's children that can be used by VariableDefinition to resolve it's initial value without having to hold onto the entire syntax tree for a source file. Not all expressions will be copy-able - e.g. a function expression won't be successfully copied, but that is OK because we can't constant evaluate a function expression anyways.
        Specified by:
        copyForInitializer in interface IExpressionNode
        Returns:
        a new IExpressionNode that is not tied to the syntax tree it came from. If a copy can not be generated, null is returned.

      • hasParenthesis

        public boolean hasParenthesis()
        Description copied from interface: IExpressionNode
        Determines whether this expression is surrounded by parenthesis. Nested parenthesis are reduced to the smallest number needed to maintain code meaning
        Specified by:
        hasParenthesis in interface IExpressionNode
        Returns:
        true if surrounded by parenthesis

      • copy

        protected abstract ExpressionNodeBase copy()
        Copy the ExpressionNodeBase and its subtree.
        Returns:
        a new ExpressionNodeBase that represents the same content as the original node

      • getMName

        public Name getMName(ICompilerProject project)
        Gets the AET Name object to be used for an expression.

        For all expression nodes except for the identifier nodes and member access nodes, this method returns null.

        This is the method that the code generator calls to determine what name to emit into the ABC file. It will handle resolving the identifier if necessary and generating the appropriate qname or multiname.

        Parameters:
        project - The ICompilerProject to use to do lookups.
        Returns:
        A AET Name object.

      • setHasParenthesis

        public void setHasParenthesis(boolean hasParens)

      • isPackageReference

        public boolean isPackageReference()
        Determine if this node is a reference to a package
        Returns:
        true if this node is really a package reference.

      • getBaseExpression

        public ExpressionNodeBase getBaseExpression()
        Get the base expression, if any. In a.b, or a.@b, or a.c::b, the base of b is a.
        Returns:
        The base as an ExpressionNodeBase, if it is one, otherwise null

      • inWith

        public boolean inWith()
        Returns:
        true if this ExpressionNodeBase is in a with scope.

      • getDecorationNode

        public ExpressionNodeBase getDecorationNode()
        Get the appropriate node at which to start decoration. This returns the largest containing expression node, which should provide enough context to figure out what the definitions are.
        Returns:
        the node that should be decorated

      • inFilter

        public final boolean inFilter()
        Check if the expression is inside a filter expression. For example: 
         xmlData.(getName() == "hello")
        getName() == "hello" is in a filter.

        The implementation walks up the parent nodes till the first ScopedBlockNode. If a MemberAccessExpressionNode with ASTNodeID.E4XFilterID is found, this node is inside a filter expression.

        Returns:
        True if this node is in a filter expression.

      • getParentExpression

        protected ExpressionNodeBase getParentExpression()
        Get the parent of this Node as an ExpressionNodeBase.
        Returns:
        the parent of this node as an ExpressionNodeBase, or null if it isn't an ExpressionNodeBase.

      • computeNamespaceReference

        public INamespaceReference computeNamespaceReference()
        Generate an INamespaceReference that can serve as the namespace reference for something like a namespace initializer.
        Returns:
        An INamespaceReference that represents this expression node or null.

      • getDependencyType

        public DependencyType getDependencyType()
        Compute the type of dependency between two compilation unit this expression node creates.
        Returns:
        The type of dependency between two compilation unit this identifier node creates.
